metadata.title: CVE-2018-3836 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable command injection vulnerability exists in thegplotMakeOutput function of Leptonica 1.74.4. A specially crafted gplotrootname argument can cause a command injection resulting in arbitrary codeexecution. An attacker can provide a malicious path as input to anapplication that passes attacker data to this function to trigger thisvulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3836` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

leptonica-progs - 1.73-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
liblept5 - 1.73-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: leptonlib package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.73-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
